newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta exchange suspends Elang Realty.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta exchange suspends Elang Realty.

text.p: The Jakarta Stock Exchange suspended the trading in shares of property firm PT Elang Realty after it fell sharply in late morning trade on Tuesday, an exchange official said.
"We have halted the trading in Elang Realty," a Jakarta Stock Exchange official told Reuters. He said the exchange would conduct an investigation before taking any further decision.
He said the exchange decided to halt the trading to prevent Elang from declining further as its share price had fallen about 30.43 percent since the market opened on Tuesday.
Elang Realty was the most active stock, with about 68.7 million shares changing hands. It fell 525 rupiah to 1,200 after touching a high of 1,875 rupiah earlier on Tuesday.
Brokers said Elang had been actively traded since last week on market talk of a possible rights issue.
"I heard Elang prices would manage to stabilise at around 1,800 rupiah today ahead of its rumoured rights issue. The rumours boosted sentiment on the stock," a broker said.
"But what happened just now (fall in Elang prices) has put presssure on overall market sentiment," he added.
